questions.question_text: Which elicitation technique is most effective for understanding user workflows?

answer_choices.explanation: Observation allows you to see how users actually perform tasks in their real work environment, revealing nuances that might not emerge in interviews.
Document analysis is useful for understanding processes as documented, but may not reflect actual practice.
Brainstorming generates ideas but doesn't capture existing workflows.
Surveys gather data at scale but lack the depth to understand complex workflows.
